glsa.title: UnZip: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A double free vulnerability discovered in UnZip might lead to the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Info-ZIP's UnZip is a tool to list and extract files inside PKZIP compressed files.

description.p: Tavis Ormandy of the Google Security Team discovered that the NEEDBITS macro in the inflate_dynamic() function in the file inflate.c can be invoked using invalid buffers, which can lead to a double free.

impact.p: Remote attackers could entice a user or automated system to open a specially crafted ZIP file that might lead to the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
